p: Since then, one of Kubanek’s collaborators, Erik Selander of the University of Gothenburg, has found that every copepod he’s studied makes these lipids. Compounds such as these had previously gone unrecognized because they’re so dilute in the water, Kubanek says. Now, “people are working on studying ocean chemistry at the single molecule level, as opposed to just bulk concentrations of types of organic compounds.”
